Optioneering and outline design relating to Transmission & Distribution and Industrial projects. Preparation of technical reports/ drawings sketches. Perform detailed design and engineering calculations of the overhead electric distribution systems to comply with the clients standards, specifications, preferences, and relevant industry standards (NESC, RUS, etc.) Guiding Engineering/ CAD team for quality delivery and ensure that Stantec Design Practices are followed. Perform self-check and QA/QC on projects before submittal to the client. Prepare cost estimates on engineering and construction packages. Develop a bill of material required for construction based on client standards. Develop permit drawings as necessary to accommodate construction. Capable to analyze, assess, evaluate the issues, complexity pertaining to projects / work packages and support the lead in mitigating them in advance. Knowledge of concrete and steel structures  analysis and design. Carry out other duties as may be assigned from time to time by supervisor/management. Need to work off-hours for regional co-ordination: Occasionally. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor/ masters degree in civil/structural engineering.  5 to 10 years of experience in transmission and distribution projects. Experienced with the use of software like PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE and PLS-TOWER. Experience in design using NA and / or UK codes and other regulations related to Transmission & distribution and Industrial projects. Experience with structural software tools like staad pro, SAP2000, ANSYS, LS DYNA, FAD Tools, and LPile will be added advantage. 2D design experience using the following Software applications will be an added advantage.  Autodesk AutoCAD Bentley MicroStation Familiarity and sufficient knowledge in related electrical studies, knowledge of electric utility systems, policies, and procedures including such as EMF, fault current, grounding, contaminants study and clearance analysis for transmission line design. Requires broad general knowledge of electrical industrial and utility power projects, including strong familiarity with other disciplines required for completion of such projects, including      Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Services, Surveying, and permitting for electrical utility companies. Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook and Office. Flexibility to prioritize and work on multiple projects with various due dates and scopes. Make an effective and collaborative contribution to the team through sharing knowledge, promoting ideas, and valuing the contribution of all team members. Innovative, result oriented, provide ideas and work on them. Experience in Data / Document management system - ProjectWise, BIM360 will be added advantage. Competent level of baseline skills, i.e. professional attitude and good written and verbal communication skills. Rigorous attention to detail, able to understand and adopt workflows and commitment to personal professional development. Flexible attitude to accepting different work assignments and pro-active attitude to execution / delivery. Thorough knowledge and understanding of international safety and HSSE regulations and requirements.

column2: Title : Electrical & Instrumentation Design Lead/Manager Job Description : Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the worlds fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then were eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills: Roles & Responsibilities: The E & I Engineer will work with Technical Lead & customer E & I team for the execution of projects within Pipeline/ Industrial/ LNG segments for trains driven by Gas Turbines/ Steam Turbines/ Compressors. He/ she will collaborate with extended Engineering project team and all other customer business functions supporting the project. An E & I Engineer will be responsible for the Electrical equipment and Instrumentation design for Gas Turbine, Steam Turbine Driven Compressor and Generator applications, Electric Motors, Reciprocating Compressors and Turboexpanders. He/ She will have the opportunity to introduce new technology to enhance company profitability and productivity. He/ She will be responsible for maintaining and incorporating new cost-effective solutions for designs. Name Plates and hook-up specifications for Electrical equipment and Instruments. Designing and tagging the Electrical and Instrumentation arrangements through the application of international standards ( e.g  ATEX, CSA, NEC/NEMA, IEC, etc). Instrument Project design Summary preparation. Modeling using 3D software for instrumentation loop arrangement based on installation condition. Designing and SMART instrumentation configuration against susceptibility electric and electromagnetic noise. Optimizing Electrical installation to standardize solution in collaboration with manufacturing department. Creation, update & Evaluation of P&IDs as per customer requirement. Preparation of list of Equipment/ Instruments/ Analyzers/ respective materials & I/O list, wiring diagram, primary and pneumatic hook-ups, ILDs, Cable and tray layouts based on the P&IDs and vendor documents, Panel layouts, Instrument annunciator racks, Electrical hook-ups, Skid instruments, Various Oil Console/ local panel/ Start-stop panel instruments. On-site Electrical Tracing, Electrical connections, Site engineering support. Preparation of Equipment/Instruments Specification / Datasheets, Purchase Specification for all type of gauges and transmitters. Project Scheduling, monitoring, and control, and maintain OTD and Quality of the Engineering documents, timely execution. Design, Document, report preparation and Certification for (Must possess knowledge and work exposure on) Process Hazard Analysis, Hazardous area classification, Lighting protection system, Fire-fighting system and explosive atmosphere certification list preparation, etc. Should have Exposure on Control Logic preparation and Operating procedure writing. Commissioning spares, 2 years operations spare parts, Calibration kit requirement listing. Required Skills (Technical Competency): 3-8 years of Experience in E & I Designing in oil and gas/petrochemical/power sector. Have proven working Experience in an engineering position for Instrumentation Engineering for Turbomachinerys, Preferable: Gas turbine/ centrifugal compressor/ steam turbine/ Reciprocating Compressor / Turboexpanders. Be proficient in electrical and instrumentation design and related development tools; knowledge of industry code and standards. Have well-developed interpersonal and communication skills; able to influence and motivate others. Be able to work in multi-cultural team and customer review meetings. Be fluent in spoken and written English. Effective team building, problem-solving abilities, and leadership skills. Tools skill: Smart Plant-3D, AutoCAD Electrical, AVEVA instrumentation, EPLAN P8, MS office & Team Center. (will be preferred) Desired skills: Bachelors degree in Electrical or Instrumentation Engineering Experience in an engineering position for Instrumentation Engineering for Turbomachinery??, Preferable: Gas turbine/ centrifugal compressor / steam turbine / Reciprocating Compressor / Turboexpanders. Work-exposure on Electrical/Instrumentation Safety aspects mentioned above Email -Syamala.Kurumaddali@quest-global.com

column2: A CAD (Computer-Aided Design) Expert is responsible for creating detailed technical drawings and plans for various projects using specialized computer software     This role involves collaborating with engineers, architects, and designers to convert their concepts and ideas into precise digital models and technical drawings     CAD Experts play a crucial role in the product development process, ensuring accuracy, feasibility, and adherence to industry standards     Key Responsibilities:Drafting and Design: Create detailed 2D and 3D models of products, structures, or components using CAD software     Develop technical drawings, blueprints, and schematics based on project requirements     Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, architects, and designers to understand project specifications and requirements     Collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate design elements and resolve design conflicts     Problem Solving: Identify and solve design issues to ensure the feasibility and functionality of the final product     Make necessary adjustments to designs based on feedback and testing     Quality Control: Review and validate technical drawings for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with industry standards and regulations     Ensure all designs meet the specified criteria and guidelines     Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of designs, revisions, and project progress     Prepare reports and presentations to communicate design concepts and updates to stakeholders     Technical Expertise: Stay updated with the latest CAD software tools, techniques, and best practices     Provide technical support and guidance to team members as needed     Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines     Coordinate with different departments to gather necessary information and ensure seamless workflow     Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in CAD workflows     Implement best practices to enhance productivity and quality of designs

responsibilities and qualifications:Job Responsibilities:Spatial Data Management: Collect, manage, and analyze geographical data using GIS software      This involves organizing and storing spatial data, performing spatial analysis, and creating maps and visualizations      Mapping and Cartography: Develop detailed and accurate maps for various purposes, including land use planning, infrastructure development, and environmental monitoring      Ensure that maps are visually appealing and easy to interpret      Data Analysis: Conduct spatial analysis to identify patterns, trends, and relationships within geographical data      Interpret the results of analysis and present findings to stakeholders      CAD Design: Create precise and detailed technical drawings and plans using CAD software      This can include architectural drawings, engineering designs, and layout plans for various projects      Database Management: Manage GIS databases, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and integrity      Perform data validation and quality control procedures      Collaboration: Collaborate with professionals from various disciplines, such as urban planners, architects, engineers, and environmental scientists, to provide GIS support and contribute to multidisciplinary projects      Software Proficiency: Stay updated with the latest GIS and CAD software and tools      Proficiency in software like ArcGIS, AutoCAD, QGIS, and other relevant applications is essential      Problem Solving: Identify and resolve GIS-related issues and challenges      Develop innovative solutions to improve efficiency and accuracy in GIS and CAD processes      Documentation: Maintain accurate records of GIS data, methodologies, and analysis results      Prepare technical reports, documentation, and presentations for internal and external stakeholders      Qualifications:Educational Background: Bachelors or Masters degree in Geography, Geomatics, Civil Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field      Additional certifications in GIS and CAD technologies are a plus      Technical Skills: Proficiency in GIS software (such as ArcGIS, QGIS) and CAD software (such as AutoCAD)      Knowledge of programming languages like Python for automation and scripting is beneficial      Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex spatial data and derive meaningful insights      Attention to Detail: Keen attention to detail and accuracy, ensuring precise mapping and data analysis      Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills      Ability to explain complex GIS concepts and analysis results to non-technical stakeholders      Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams and coordinate with professionals from diverse backgrounds      Time Management: Effective time management skills to handle multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously      Industry Knowledge: Knowledge of industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to GIS and CAD applications in fields such as urban planning, environmental management, civil engineering, and architecture

column2: A CAD (Computer-Aided Design) Expert is responsible for creating detailed technical drawings and plans for various projects using specialized computer software     This role involves collaborating with engineers, architects, and designers to convert their concepts and ideas into precise digital models and technical drawings     CAD Experts play a crucial role in the product development process, ensuring accuracy, feasibility, and adherence to industry standards     Key Responsibilities:Drafting and Design: Create detailed 2D and 3D models of products, structures, or components using CAD software     Develop technical drawings, blueprints, and schematics based on project requirements     Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, architects, and designers to understand project specifications and requirements     Collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate design elements and resolve design conflicts     Problem Solving: Identify and solve design issues to ensure the feasibility and functionality of the final product     Make necessary adjustments to designs based on feedback and testing     Quality Control: Review and validate technical drawings for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with industry standards and regulations     Ensure all designs meet the specified criteria and guidelines     Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of designs, revisions, and project progress     Prepare reports and presentations to communicate design concepts and updates to stakeholders     Technical Expertise: Stay updated with the latest CAD software tools, techniques, and best practices     Provide technical support and guidance to team members as needed     Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines     Coordinate with different departments to gather necessary information and ensure seamless workflow     Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in CAD workflows     Implement best practices to enhance productivity and quality of designs
column11: CAD, highway engineering, Civil engineering

column2: Prepare and develop arrangement and detail conceptual, FEED, studies, and detail design drawings of high technical quality and professional consistent presentation ensuring clarity and ease of construction.      Develop 3D models and ensure clash free with all other disciplines.      Ensure design deliverables are completed and issued per project specifications, MDR and project Level 2 & 3 procedures, and within agreed schedules.      Apply knowledge and/or skills to complete a variety of day-to-day activities within own area.      Continue developing skills to complete repetitive tasks efficiently.      Prioritize and organize own work to meet agreed upon deadlines.          Essential Qualifications and Education:          6 years min with major contractor or consultant of which 2+ years of experience in oil and gas      High School graduate with a diploma in Civil, Electrical or Mechanical Design, or Drafting in a related discipline or equivalent experience          Preferred Qualifications and Education:          Knowledge of QA Systems and a good communicator. Detailed knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Auto lisp Programming, 3D Model creation, Menu and/or Macro compilation skills would be an advantage.      Detailed knowledge of associated industry detailing standards. Detailed knowledge of 3D and 2D drafting systems (AutoCAD and/or MicroStation). Working experience in E3D and/or S3D.          Key Tasks and Responsibilities:          Become fully familiar with the Contract Scope of Work, specifications, schedule and all inter-discipline requirements; including identifying concerns as early as practicable and taking appropriate initiatives to address the issues.      Identify changes to scope and promptly raise change notification in the Change Management system, including providing any necessary supporting documentation and estimates. Provide similar support for Variation Orders.      Interface with all disciplines to develop clash free designs.      Interface with other disciplines to obtain input for Discipline designs and drawings.      Liaise with other discipline support groups to ensure clearly defined interfaces, deliverables and schedules are met.      Document substantive communications (communications that result in significant decisions or assignment of actions), and forward copies to Discipline Lead Designer and Discipline Supervisor.      Assist Discipline Lead Designer in preparing estimates for proposals and job scope changes, including execution statements, work schedules, and man-hour requirements.      Raise technical queries to obtain missing information, clarify work scope, and to maintain preferred McDermott procedures, specifications, standards, practices and operational requirements.      Participate in finalizing deliverables lists, deliverables and philosophies to ensure compliance with specifications and functional integrity.      Attend project kickoff and review meetings, vendor/supplier meetings, engineering and design meetings and offshore site surveys as required.      Research Customer standards and procedures in order to prepare project-specific design procedures and standards for submission to the Customer for approval.      Set up and maintain the Discipline Master design drawing and document files, including final archiving.      Prepare and review Discipline deliverables such as:      3D model      Detailed design drawings      As-built drawings          Review drawings issued by other disciplines and incorporate the required data into Discipline drawings.      Review vendor drawings and documents and incorporate required vendor data into Discipline drawings and documents.      Assist in providing necessary design inputs to other disciplines to enable them in proceeding with their deliverables.      Identify all items for which insufficient data is available to allow the drawing or model to be completed (HOLDS), and list these on the drawing and on the standard 'HOLDS' list form. Notify the Discipline Lead Designer when there are updates to the Holds list.      Generate IDC design documentation for the project.      Perform design verification through single discipline checks (SDC) and/or inter-discipline checks (IDC), providing comments to Lead Designer.      Review all project IDC design documentation for detail technical interfaces.      Maintain single discipline and inter-discipline check drawings and filing.      Prepare, issue and update material and weight data take-offs.      Assist Fabrication as required in the resolution of construction difficulties relating to design problems, clashes, etc.      Monitor progress and maintain the Discipline deliverables register on an ongoing basis.      Ensure compliance with the Project Execution Plan and the timely completion and archiving of drawings and documents.      Keep Lead Designer apprised of all activities, progress and concerns, including manpower and budgetary related.      Assist in providing inputs for actual, planning and forecasting progress reports including associated productivity.      Report errors and suggest resolution for same.      Participate in design reviews and audits.      Capture lessons learned and enter into MDR's Lessons Learned system.      Guide less experienced Designers on MDR and Discipline procedures, standards, worksheets, design calculations, software, technical queries, etc.      Provide guidance to trainee Designers.      Assist in the maintenance of departmental technical guidelines and standards.      Further develop understanding of MDR's business including processes and procedures.      Prepare / review Electrical Design deliverables such as:      3D model Electrical scopes      One-line diagrams      Schematics      Interconnection and wiring diagrams      Block diagrams      Area classification drawings      Conduit and cable schedules Power layout drawings      Earthing/grounding layout drawings Lighting layout drawings      Electrical cable tray drawings Electrical building drawings Electrical support drawings Electrical drawing indexes Lighting design calculations      Cable sizing          Prepare / review bills of material and perform material take-offs for electrical items including cables, lighting fixtures, cable trays, cable glands, termination kits, and MCTs.      Participate in clash resolution meetings, as required.      Travel to fabrication yard to assist in mechanical completion, hookup, and/or commissioning, as required.

column2: Please copy the below link and paste in your browser to apply on the position. https://jobs.exxonmobil.com/ExxonMobil/job/Bengaluru-Project-Design-Engineer-KA/1074198900/ Job Title: Project Design Engineer ExxonMobil affiliates in India ExxonMobils affiliates have offices in India in Bengaluru, Mumbai and the National Capital Region.? ExxonMobils affiliates in India supporting the Product Solutions business engage in the marketing, sales and distribution of performance as well as specialty products across chemicals and lubricants businesses. The India planning teams are also embedded with global business units for business planning and analytics. ExxonMobils LNG affiliate in India supporting the upstream business provides consultant services for other ExxonMobil upstream affiliates and conducts LNG market-development activities. The Global Business Center - Technology Center provides a range of technical and business support services for ExxonMobil?? operations around the globe. ExxonMobil strives to make a positive contribution to the communities where we operate and its affiliates support a range of education, health and community-building programs in India. Read more about our  Corporate Responsibility Framework. To know more about ExxonMobil in India, visit  ExxonMobil India  and the  Energy Factor India. What role you will play in our team The Bengaluru Technology Center Process Engineering Group is building a world class team of Process Engineers, with demonstrated design/operations experience and technical/business judgment capabilities, to support all phases of the Facility Lifecycle: Conceptual Engineering (Concept Selection, Preliminary Front End Engineering Design [Pre-FEED] Project Execution (FEED and Detailed Design/EPC, Start-up) Successful candidates will develop their skills and abilities within role in the following areas to lead/be part of a team supporting a wide variety of projects and/or operating facilities, ranging from:? small brownfield projects to major capital projects, greenfield to brownfield, onshore to offshore, sweet to sour designs, conventional oil and gas to LNG and downstream Refining and Chemicals.? They will be highly integrated with project delivery organizations located outside of India and will work as part of an extended international team in a highly distributed organization, using virtual communication as well as facilitating high quality execution via our Indian contracting partners. This is an office-based?position in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. What you will do Primary Job Functions The Process Engineering team will be responsible for the following: Conceptual Engineering: Executing Facility Concept Selection and Pre-FEED Capable of leading capital project development or design efforts through the company Capital Project System Leading or as part of an integrated team, develop scope definition for various facility concepts and analyzing/recommending results to maximize?business value. Ensure full alignment of recommended scope with Business Teams, Manufacturing Site/Operations, Process Technology Specialists and Engineering Specialists providing design input to cost estimating models. Develop required deliverables:? Process Simulation models, Equipment Lists, Flow Diagrams (Block, Process, Utility), Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), Equipment Data Sheets, Layouts, Design Philosophies, Heat & Material Balances, Design Basis documentation, Optimization/Cost Reduction studies, Benchmarking facility design against previous projects / operating?facilities. Provide mentoring, oversight and perform technical reviews of the work of less experienced process designers, ensuring delivery of quality and capital efficiency while meeting schedule?requirements. Engineering Execution: Providing Engineering Surveillance of Facilities/Process Engineering deliverables required for FEED and Detailed Design/EPC execution. Ensuring compliance with job specification, design methods and safety factors are correctly applied in the design. ??roviding operability reviews for startup, normal, turndown, and shutdown modes. Establishing design basis for abnormal operating conditions Development and review of Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs), heat and material balances (H&MBs), Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs) for process safety and operability considerations.? Selection and specification of process and process control components Participate/lead design reviews, Risk Assessments, HAZOPs, vendor bid evaluations, and project readiness?reviews. Development of the schedule, recommended deliverables, and labor hour estimate for process engineering.? Measurement and reporting of physical progress. Participate in planning and work allocation process for the process design?discipline. Develop planning documentation for internal company reviews for funding recommendations. About You Skills and Qualifications Bachelor?? degree or higher in Chemical Engineering, with GPA 7.0 or above Minimum of 5 years of process engineering experience in the oil and gas industry Technical Experience in oil and gas production facilities or Refining and Chemical facilities, including operating, technical support, or design experience in one or more of the following process areas: Conventional Onshore and Offshore Oil and Gas LNG ?(Regasification and Liquefaction) Sour Oil and Gas Treatment NGL recovery Produced Water Treatment ? ?? Associated Utilities and Safety Systems Refining Processes Chemical Processes Hydrogen generation Carbon sequestration? Familiarity with the selection and application of process and utilities systems in the process areas listed above Familiarity with safety aspects in design (API 14C/J recommended practices, relief and blowdown, passive and active fire protection, etc.) Ability to design new process equipment and rate existing process equipment to determine if it is suitable for modified operating parameters. Working capabilities in some of the following programs and data flows between them: AspenTech Engineering Suite including HYSYS, Aspen Basic Engineering, Aspen Capital Cost Estimator Siemens COMOS AVEVA Engineering Suite (Front End Engineering through 3D Modeling) Intergraph / Hexagon Engineering Suite PRO-II Other similar types of commercially available engineering suites   Non-Technical A highly motivated team player with excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to build successful working relationships in a virtual environment Displays cultural sensitivity within the context of a multicultural and globally distributed team Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software programs Strong organizational, planning/coordination, interface, and technical judgment skills. Ability to effectively self-priorities activities and demonstrate personal flexibility within the team environment to achieve the business objective Ability to interface with non-Engineering disciplines to achieve common objectives Ability to work both independently and collaboratively Willing and able to travel internationally as required Your benefits An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep: our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life.?We offer you:? Competitive compensation? Medical plans, maternity leave and benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment benefits? Retirement benefits? column2: Role   :   Mechanical   Design   Engineer Industry   Type   :   Industrial   Equipment   /   Machinery Salary   :   As   per   industry   standard Experience   :   5-8   years Location   :   White   House,   Park   Street,   Kolkata Job   Type   :   Full   Time Overview: As a Mechanical Design Engineer, you will conceptualize, design, and develop suspended access solutions. Working as part of a larger engineering team, this role requires creativity and precision to transform engineering specifications into robust designs that excel in functionality, performance, and safety. Key   Responsibilities: ?? Design   Development:  Use computer-aided design (CAD) software to create detailed 3D models and 2D  engineering drawings, ensuring comprehensive and executable designs. This involves translating engineering  requirements into detailed designs that meet functional, performance, and safety specification ?? Engineering   Analysis:  Perform extensive engineering calculations to analyze stress, strain, and other  relevant factors, ensuring that all designs are structurally sound and operate efficiently.  Conventional   strength   calculations  and Implement Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to enhance design precision and effectiveness ?? Material   Selection:  Select materials that are strong, lightweight, cost-effective, and meet application  requirements ?? Collaboration:  Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers, manufacturing specialists, and other stakeholders to bring your designs from concept to reality. ?? Prototyping   and   Testing:  Engage in prototyping and testing to evaluate product functionality, performance, and manufacturability ?? Innovation   and   Research:  Keep abreast of the latest advancements in mechanical engineering technologies and advanced materials ?? Remote   Communication:  Communicate progress and updates clearly with remote supervisor and other stakeholders, ensuring effective reporting and coordination  Qualifications: ??A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field ??Proficiency in using computer-aided design (CAD) software, specifically Autocad 2D and experience or knowledge of 3D CAD software or other. ??Strong analytical and problem-solving skills ??Excellent understanding of mechanical engineering principles, including statics, mechanics of materials, and Finite Element Analysis ??Attention to detail and the ability to produce high-quality technical drawings ??Effective communication and teamwork skills with concise reporting, essential for collaborating with remote  supervisors and team members ??Ability to work independently and effectively manage tasks remotely About   the   Company: Hi-Tech is a leading national provider of highly engineered, technologically advanced products and services in high performance markets. We have been partnering of the development of power and process industries since 1989 with HO & manufacturing facility in Kolkata & Howrah and operate out of 12 locations in India. www.hitech.in Hi-Tech Systems and Services recently acquired three companies in the manufacturing and engineering segment paving the way for a broader product line, enhanced technical competence, and expanded reach. column2: Experience Level   : 5 to 10 years in Substation, Switchyard, and Transmission Line Design          ?       Job Description   :       We are seeking a skilled Substation Design Engineer to join our Design Department.      The ideal candidate should have 5 to 10 years of experience in Substation, Switchyard, and Transmission Line design, with a deep understanding of both primary and secondary engineering aspects of substations.      Knowledge of AIS (Air Insulated Substation) and GIS (Gas Insulated Substation) designs up to 400kV is essential for this role.         Key Responsibilities   :       Prepare various drawings, including Single Line Diagrams (SLD), Layouts, Sections, Earthing, Distribution System Lightning Protection (DSLP), Cable Trenches, Control Room Equipment Layouts, Lighting Layouts, and Transmission Line designs.     Conduct engineering calculations, such as DSLP (Distribution System Lightning Protection), Earthing, CT (Current Transformer) Sizing, VT (Voltage Transformer) Sizing, DG (Diesel Generator) Sizing, Transformer Sizing, Conductor Sizing, Short Circuit Current Calculation, Short Circuit Force Calculation, Battery Sizing Calculation, Cable Sizing Calculation, Cable Schedules, and Illumination.     Be familiar with civil design aspects related to substations and transmission lines.     Maintain knowledge of applicable Indian and international codes of practice, including IS (Indian Standards), BIS (Bureau of Indian Standards), CBIP (Central Board of Irrigation and Power), CEA (Central Electricity Authority), IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission), IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers), ISA (Instrument Society of America), and others.     Understand and adhere to the standard practices of leading utilities in India, such as PGCIL (Power Grid Corporation of India Limited), NTPC (National Thermal Power Corporation), DTL (Delhi Transco Limited), HVPNL (Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited), GETCO (Gujarat Energy Transmission Corporation), KPTCL (Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation), APTRANSCO (Andhra Pradesh Transmission Corporation), MAHATRANSCO (Maharashtra State Electricity Transmission Company), and others.     Prepare and review technical specifications, General Technical Part (GTP), and Method Statements.     Manage the preparation and updates of Master Document List (MDL) and ensure proper document control.     Review vendor drawings and coordinate with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), customers, and consultants as needed.     Prepare and maintain accurate As-Built documents.         Qualifications   :       A bachelors degree in electrical engineering or a related field.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.     Proficiency in relevant design software and tools.     Proven experience in substation design projects.     If you possess the required expertise and are ready to take on the challenge of designing and engineering substations and transmission lines, we encourage you to apply for this Substation Design Engineer position.
column11: GIS, Transmission line, Analytical, Power transmission, Transmission, thermal, Diesel generator, Civil design, substation design, IEEE

column2: Battery Electrical Engineer Job Purpose (Significance of the role & Objectives) The Electrical Engineer at Pravaig is responsible for the design, development, and execution of core battery electrical system components and assemblies. The individual will be responsible for defining, documenting, and designing battery pack and battery module bussing and wiring components and overseeing the validation of those components and assemblies. An effective candidate is comfortable applying technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving the resolution of challenges, and taking ownership of new product development activities. Key Responsibilities and Deliverables Technical ownership and delivery of electrical and electronics design through the entire development cycle. Provide engineering support for the development of electronic hardware systems including system integration. Support prototype and engineering build during the development phase. Highly experienced in contactor control, pre-charge, EMI, EMC, electrical power distribution, electrical interference, high-voltage junction boxes, and functional safety.  Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of cell electrical interconnections & bussing, module and pack high current and high voltage electrical interconnections & bussing, fusing, sensing, and control circuitry. Work with vendors to develop custom components to meet design development requirements. Work with the mechanical engineering team to develop battery modules and protection control systems.  Support the final assembly site to ensure proper integration of the battery into the final system.  Rigorous failure analysis, root cause analysis, corrective action, and communication to the cross-functional internal stack holders on issues.??? Ability to improve the high-voltage and high-power battery pack electrical and electronics architecture. Ensure successful integration with the other subsystems within the drivetrain. Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team. Desired Qualifications: Required Qualification, Knowledge, and Experience Strong electrical and electronics fundamentals.????? Experience in safe implementation and selection of high-current carrying cables and high-voltage cables and busbars. Experience and capabilities for DFM, DFMEA, PFMEA and DFA.  Basic understanding CAD tool skills such as SOLIDWORK or UG NX and the Ability to learn and adapt to new tools. Strong leadership skills and proactive behavior. Demonstrated knowledge of electrical tests (EMC, fuse time/current characteristics, fuse coordination, electrical component durability) and equipment preferred.? Ltd. is looking for Design Engineer - Electrical to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Electrical System Design: Design and develop electrical systems, components, and products for a wide range of applications, ensuring they meet performance, safety, and regulatory requirements.      Schematic Design: Create detailed electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, and layouts using CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks Electrical).      Component Selection: Select appropriate electrical components, including sensors, actuators, controllers, and power distribution systems, based on project requirements and specifications.      Prototyping and Testing: Build and test prototypes of electrical systems and components, identifying and resolving design issues and optimizing performance.      Safety and Compliance: Ensure that electrical designs comply with safety standards and regulations (e.g., NEC, IEC, UL) and address potential safety hazards.      Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of electrical designs, including BOMs (Bills of Materials), schematics, and technical specifications.      Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, software engineers, and project managers, to ensure successful project execution.      Cost Optimization: Work to optimize the cost-effectiveness of electrical designs while maintaining quality and safety standards.      Diploma engineer / Graduate Engineer in Electrical with 2 to 7 years experience in Electrical Panel and Cable Layout Design

column2: Senior Electrical Design Engineer - Solar PV Hyderabad Full-time   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Electrical Design Engineer with extensive experience in the design and implementation of solar photovoltaic power plants. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical engineering with focus on renewable energy projects.    Responsibilities: Lead the design and engineering efforts for solar photovoltaic power plant projects, ensuring compliance with technical standards, industry best practices, and project requirements. Conduct site assessments and feasibility studies to determine optimal locations for solar power plant installations, considering factors such as solar irradiance, terrain, shading, and environmental impact. Develop detailed system designs, including solar array layouts, electrical schematics, equipment specifications, and structural designs, to maximize energy production and efficiency. Perform electrical engineering calculations and simulations to optimize system performance, voltage levels, power distribution, and protection coordination. Select appropriate solar panels, inverters, mounting structures, and other components based on performance, reliability, cost, and compatibility with project requirements. Coordinate with interdisciplinary teams, including civil engineers, environmental specialists, and project managers, to ensure seamless project execution and compliance with regulatory requirements. Prepare technical documentation, including engineering drawings, specifications, calculations, and reports, to support project planning, permitting, and construction activities. Conduct quality assurance reviews to ensure that designs meet quality standards, performance requirements, and customer expectations. Stay informed about the latest advancements in solar technology, materials, and design techniques, and incorporate innovative solutions to enhance project performance and competitiveness. Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, learning, and continuous improvement.    Qualification: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy Engineering, or related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 7-8 years of experience in the design and engineering of solar photovoltaic power plants or renewable energy projects. Proficiency in solar photovoltaic system design software (e.g., PVsyst, Helioscope, PVSOL) and electrical engineering software (e.g., ETAP, SKM, AutoCAD). Strong understanding of electrical engineering principles, power systems analysis, and solar energy technologies. Experience with project management methodologies, including scheduling, budgeting, and risk management. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross- functional teams and stakeholders. Experience with renewable energy project development, permitting, and regulatory compliance is a plus. Commitment to sustainability, renewable energy, and environmental stewardship.

This role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless integration of EE systems, adherence to industry standards, and optimising performance of electronic systems. column2: We are excited to announce that Technip Energies is currently seeking for  Lead Engineer - Electrical Design  to join our team at our  Chennai  Office. As a global and leading engineering and technology company, we are committed to accelerating the energy transition and designing and delivering added value energy solutions. Responsibilities for this position include preparing and checking single line diagrams, detailed calculations for major electrical equipment, and design calculations for earthing, lighting, cable sizing, and cable tray/trench sizing. You will also be responsible for checking electrical layouts, understanding substation automation systems, and coordinating with other engineering disciplines for inputs and technical issues. Additionally, you will be responsible for preparing cost estimates and quantity take offs, supporting field engineering and troubleshooting, and adhering to corporate QHSE policy. To be considered for this position, you must have a Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with at least 10+ years of relevant industry experience. A Master's Degree in Engineering (M.E./M.Tech) shall be an added advantage. You should be conversant with ETAP, SEL, and other lighting software and have experience in Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, Fertilizer industries. You should also be well-versed with Indian & International codes and have strong written and verbal communication skills in English. At Technip Energies, we offer a supportive and collaborative work environment where you can grow and develop your skills. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, we encourage you to apply for this position. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter. Once we receive your application, a recruiter will perform an initial check between your skills and qualifications with our stated requirements prior to a detailed and focused review carried with the hiring manager. We expect to take up to a few weeks to perform that review. If you hear from us, it is because we want to organize interviews and meet you physically or virtually upon locations. To have an overview of the recruitment process, visit our dedicated webpage here. We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn for company updates. Thank you for considering Technip Energies as your next career opportunity.

column2: Responsibilities:  Electrical Design: Lead and contribute to the development of electrical system designs and solutions for our advanced industrial machinery, adhering to company standards, safety regulations, and customer specifications.  PLC Programming: Expertly program, configure, and troubleshoot programmable logic controllers (PLCs) to control and automate various functions in our industrial equipment.  Electrical Circuit Drawing: Utilize your proficiency in AUTOCAD and EPLAN software to create precise and detailed electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, and layouts for seamless implementation by the assembly and installation teams.  Component Selection: Identify and recommend appropriate electrical components and materials, considering factors such as functionality, cost-effectiveness, and availability to optimize machine performance.  Collaborative Projects: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, project managers, and fellow electrical engineers, to ensure the successful integration of electrical systems into our machinery designs.  Testing and Validation: Conduct thorough testing and validation of electrical systems to verify their performance, reliability, and compliance with design requirements and industry standards.  Troubleshooting: Analyze and resolve complex electrical issues that may arise during the design, manufacturing, or operational phases of our projects.  Documentation: Maintain meticulous documentation of electrical designs, modifications, and updates throughout the project lifecycle to ensure accuracy and facilitate future reference.  Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization and efficiency enhancements within the electrical design department to elevate the quality and effectiveness of our solutions.  Compliance and Safety: Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and best practices, ensuring that all electrical designs align with safety standards and applicable guidelines. Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.  Proven 4-8 years of experience as an Electrical Design Engineer within a machine building company or industrial equipment manufacturing environment.  Strong expertise in PLC programming, configuration, and troubleshooting.  Extensive knowledge of electrical circuit design, wiring, and control systems.  Proficiency in using AUTOCAD and EPLAN software for electrical design and schematics.  Familiarity with relevant industry standards and safety regulations related to electrical design.  Demonstrated experience in component selection and understanding of various electrical components and materials.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment.  Analytical mindset and problem-solving capabilities to identify and resolve complex electrical issues.  Highly organized with an acute attention to detail to ensure accurate documentation and design integrity. Preferred Qualifications:  B.E  ECE / EEE or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.  Experience in designing electrical systems for complex industrial machinery or automation solutions.  Familiarity with other relevant software tools used in the industry.  Knowledge of international electrical standards and regulations.
column11: Electrical Design, eplan, circuit, Circuit Designing, Power Management, Simulation, configuration, plc, design, control system, component selection, SCADA

column2: The Advanced Design Engineer is responsible for designing and developing new vehicles which meet future regulatory requirements and customer competitive requirements.          This group is responsible for vehicle architecture, vehicle packaging, and initial systems and component engineering design.          In addition, the team resolves packaging and adaptation issues as the vehicles move toward production.          The engineers responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, establishing physical and functional integration of vehicle systems and components during the program planning phase (concept to program approval), translating strategic and functional objectives into technical requirements, creating and analyzing alternative design concepts, packaging and integrating systems and components, and benchmarking of competitive vehicles.          The candidate will achieve these tasks by leading an extended cross functional team to balance all requirements to achieve the most optimal solution. Presentation of design concepts to higher levels of management will be required.              Basic Qualifications:                  Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or equivalent from equivalent program          5+years of vehicle engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:          Body-in-White, Electrical, Interior Systems, Powertrain Adaptations, Engine Systems (Cooling, Fuel, Exhaust), or Chassis Systems          Expertise in TeamCenter, NX CAD Software & Vis Mockup with demonstrated skills to:          Develop new corporate preproduction and manage production CAD data structures.          Position and manipulate models, cut sections, analyze existing designs.          Create and analyze alternative designs and integrate systems and components.          Create specialized CAD sessions to support high level and detailed management reviews.          Excellent communication skills to lead others to coordinate and resolve issues across all regions.          Able to effectively operate independently and in a cross-functional team environment.          Strong Microsoft Office and Google Suite skills          Results driven              Preferred Qualifications:                  Master of Science degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering          Broad vehicle knowledge          Ability to integrate stakeholder requirements into final vehicle design          Excellent communication skills          Excellent relationship building skills          Ability to productively manage change          Ability to present ideas and concepts successfully to all level s of management          Excellent MS Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook)

column2: As a Qualcomm Hardware Engineer, you will plan, design, optimize, verify, and test electronic systems, bring-up yield, circuits, mechanical systems,              Digital/Analog/RF/optical             systems, equipment and packaging, test systems, FPGA, and/or DSP systems that launch cutting-edge, world class products. Qualcomm Hardware Engineers collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions and meet performance requirements.                 Minimum Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of Hardware Engineering or related work experience.    OR   Masters degree in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Engineering, or related field and 1+ year of Hardware Engineering or related work experience.    OR   PhD in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Engineering, or related field.                 Preferred Qualifications:             Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.       3+ years of Hardware Engineering or related work experience.     2+ years of experience with circuit design (eg, digital, analog, RF).     2+ years of experience utilizing schematic capture and circuit simulation software.       2+ years of experience with hardware design and measurement instruments such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, RF tools, etc                 Principal Duties and Responsibilities:           Applies Hardware knowledge and experience to plan, optimize, verify, and test electronic systems, bring-up yield, circuits, mechanical systems, Digital/Analog/RF/optical systems, equipment and packaging, test systems, FPGA, and/or DSP systems.     Integrates features and functionality into hardware designs in line with proposals or roadmaps.     Conducts simulations and analyses of designs as well as implements designs with the best power, performance, and area.     Collaborates with teams (eg, design, verification, validation, software and systems engineering, architecture development teams, etc) to implement new requirements and incorporate the latest test solutions in the production program to improve the yield, test time, and quality.     Evaluates, characterizes, and develops the manufacturing solutions for leading edge products in processes and bring-up product to meet customer expectations and schedules.     Evaluates reliability of materials, properties, and techniques and brings innovation, automation, and optimization to maximize productivity.     Assists in the assessment of complex design features to identify potential flaws, compatibility issues, and/or compliance issues.     Writes detailed technical documentation for Hardware projects.               Level of Responsibility:               Works independently with minimal supervision.             Decision-making    may affect work beyond immediate work group.           Requires verbal and written communication skills to convey information. May require basic negotiation, influence, tact, etc      Tasks require multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning, problem-solving, and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively.
column11: Automation, Simulation, RF, FPGA, Analog, Circuit designing, Hardware design, Packaging, Principal, Technical documentation

Other responsibilities will include quality improvements, value optimization, weight reduction and other efficiency improvement initiatives including communicating technical product status to management. General understanding of NX, TeamCenter and CoDeP preferred.

column2: As a Senior Design Engineer specializing in wiring harnesses for medical equipment, you will play a critical role in the development of our innovative products. Your extensive experience and expertise in ISO 13485 and UL requirements will ensure the highest standards of safety, quality, and compliance in our medical devices.       Wiring Harness Design: Develop wiring harnesses for medical equipment, ensuring compliance with ISO 13485 and UL requirements, industry standards, safety regulations, and quality standards.     Product Integration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, and product designers, to seamlessly integrate wiring harnesses into medical devices while meeting regulatory standards.     Electronic Electrical Component Selection: Select appropriate wiring components, connectors, and materials to meet the specific needs of each medical equipment project, considering ISO 13485 and UL compliance.     Prototyping: Create prototypes and perform testing to validate wiring harness designs, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and make necessary improvements.     Documentation: Generate detailed engineering documentation, including schematics, wiring diagrams, bills of materials, and manufacturing instructions, adhering to ISO 13485 documentation requirements.     Quality Assurance: Participate in quality control processes to ensure the reliability and safety of wiring harnesses in medical devices, aligning with ISO 13485 and UL quality standards.     Regulatory Compliance: Stay up-to-date with ISO 13485 and UL requirements and other industry regulations, and ensure that wiring harness designs strictly adhere to these requirements.     Cost Management: Work within budget constraints and seek cost-effective solutions without compromising quality while considering ISO 13485 and UL compliance.     Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and contribute to the development of best practices in wiring harness design, especially in relation to ISO 13485 and UL requirements.     Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and technicians on wiring harness design principles, regulatory compliance, and best practices.     Proposals: for techno-commercial offers for medical device     Cross-functional: work with BD team

column2: Design and Development: Lead the design and development of mechanical components and systems for various products. This involves conceptualization, prototyping, and finalization of designs while ensuring adherence to project requirements and specifications.     Simulation and Analysis: Utilize simulation software such as ANSYS, SolidWorks Simulation, or similar tools to analyze and optimize designs for performance, durability, and safety. Conduct finite element analysis (FEA) simulations to validate design decisions.     Automation Design: Design and implement automated systems and processes to streamline manufacturing operations. Develop concepts for robotic solutions, automated assembly lines, and material handling systems, with a focus on improving efficiency and reducing production costs.     CAD Modeling: Proficiently use CAD software such as SolidWorks, Siemens NX (formerly known as Unigraphics), or PTC Creo (formerly known as Pro/ENGINEER) to create detailed 3D models and assemblies. Ensure accuracy and manufacturability of designs through thorough geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T).     Prototyping and Testing: Coordinate the fabrication of prototypes and oversee testing procedures to evaluate the performance and functionality of mechanical components. Analyze test results and iterate designs as necessary to achieve desired outcomes.     Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, electrical engineers, and manufacturing personnel to align design objectives with overall project goals. Communicate technical concepts and design updates effectively through reports, presentations, and meetings.     Project Management: Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, from initial concept to final production release. Develop project timelines, allocate resources, and track progress to ensure timely delivery within budgetary constraints.     Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest advancements in mechanical engineering, simulation techniques, and automation technologies.      Participate in professional development activities such as training programs, workshops, and industry conferences.           Key Skills and Qualifications:           bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering      Proficiency in CAD software such as SolidWorks, Siemens NX, or PTC Creo.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret simulation results and make data-driven design decisions.     Experience in finite element analysis (FEA)and other simulation techniques.     Knowledge of automation principles and experience with robotic systems and PLC programming is advantageous.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.     Project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage timelines, and mitigate risks.     Familiarity with industry standards and regulations related to mechanical design and manufacturing processes

column2: Role & responsibilities   Requirements Analysis: Understand the specific requirements for the EOT crane. This includes factors such as load capacity, span, lifting height, duty cycle, environmental conditions, and any special features required. Conceptual Design: Develop initial concepts for the crane based on the requirements analysis. This involves deciding on the crane type (single girder, double girder, etc.), the type of hoist (wire rope or chain), the control system, and other major components. Structural Design: Determine the structural requirements for the crane, including the size and material of the crane girder, end trucks, and runway beams. Consider factors such as static and dynamic loads, fatigue, and safety factors. Mechanical Design: Design the mechanical components of the crane, such as the hoist mechanism, trolley, wheels, brakes, and gearbox. Ensure that these components are capable of meeting the required load capacities and operating speeds. Electrical Design: Design the electrical system of the crane, including the motors, motor controls, power supply, limit switches, and safety features such as overload protection and emergency stop systems. Safety Analysis: Perform a thorough safety analysis of the crane design to identify and mitigate potential hazards. This may include structural analysis, electrical safety checks, and risk assessments. Prototype Development (if applicable): Build and test a prototype of the crane to validate the design and identify any issues that need to be addressed. Documentation: Prepare detailed drawings, specifications, and documentation for the final design. This documentation is essential for manufacturing, installation, and maintenance of the crane. Manufacturing Support: Work closely with manufacturers to ensure that the crane is built according to the design specifications and meets quality standards. Installation and Testing: Oversee the installation of the crane at the customer's site and conduct thorough testing to ensure that it operates safely and meets performance requirements. Preferred candidate profile     Industry exposure of  5+ years , preferably in industry similar to EOT cranes/ Hoist manufacturing  B.E. Mechanical Engineer/ B. Tech Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Willingness to learn new technologies and concepts

column2: We are excited to announce that Technip Energies is currently seeking for  Engineer/Senior Engineer  Instrumentation Design  to join our team at our  Chennai  Office. As a global and leading engineering and technology company, we are committed to accelerating the energy transition and designing and delivering added value energy solutions. Responsibilities for this position include preparing and checking single line diagrams, detailed calculations for major electrical equipment, and design calculations for earthing, lighting, cable sizing, and cable tray/trench sizing. You will also be responsible for checking electrical layouts, understanding substation automation systems, and coordinating with other engineering disciplines for inputs and technical issues. Additionally, you will be responsible for preparing cost estimates and quantity take offs, supporting field engineering and troubleshooting, and adhering to corporate QHSE policy.   To be considered for this position, you must have a Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with at least 5+ years of relevant industry experience. A Master's Degree in Engineering (M.E./M.Tech) shall be an added advantage. You should be conversant with ETAP, SEL, and other lighting software and have experience in Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, Fertilizer industries. You should also be well-versed with Indian & International codes and have strong written and verbal communication skills in English.   At Technip Energies, we offer a supportive and collaborative work environment where you can grow and develop your skills. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals.   If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, we encourage you to apply for this position. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter. Once we receive your application, a recruiter will perform an initial check between your skills and qualifications with our stated requirements prior to a detailed and focused review carried with the hiring manager. We expect to take up to a few weeks to perform that review. If you hear from us, it is because we want to organize interviews and meet you physically or virtually upon locations.    To have an overview of the recruitment process, visit our dedicated webpage here. We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.    Thank you for considering Technip Energies as your next career opportunity.

column2: As a Technical Designer, you will play a crucial role in translating design concepts  into detailed technical drawings and specifications. Your primary responsibility is  to prepare & ensure the accuracy and quality of technical output, including 2D  drawings, detailing, cutlist and material specifications. Key Responsibilities: 2D Drawings and Detailing: -Create detailed 2D drawings, including plans, elevations, and sections, using AutoCAD as per client requirements and designers specifications. -Ensure comprehensive detailing and annotation to accurately represent project requirements. -Prepare detailed drawings and specifications for internal components of kitchen, wardrobes, and storage units, adhering to design standards and  client preferences. Site Validation and Incorporation of Changes: -Participate in site validation processes alongside the design and project management teams to identify discrepancies. -Incorporate changes and rectify errors identified during site validation into the design documentation promptly. Cutlist and Bill of Materials (BOM) Preparation: -Generate comprehensive cutlists detailing the type and size of materials required for each project component. -Ensure accuracy in reflecting project specifications and requirements in the cutlists and BOMs. Material Optimization:Analyze drawings and specifications to optimize material usage and minimize waste, contributing to cost-effective project execution. Quality Control: Adhere to quality standards for all technical outputs, ensuring precision and accuracy in drawings and specifications. Requirements: AutoCAD Proficiency: Strong proficiency in AutoCAD is essential for this role. Education: Diploma/Degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering, or Interior Design. Experience: 4 to 6 years of experience in a similar role, preferably with a focus on residential interiors and furniture manufacturing. Technical Expertise: Previous experience in preparing Reflected Ceiling Plan layouts, false ceiling detailing, custom furniture drawings, electrical, lighting, and plumbing layouts. Software Proficiency: Proficiency in AutoCAD, SketchUp, cutlist and BOM tools, and Microsoft Office Suite. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail with the ability to work collaboratively as part of a team. Knowledge and Experience: Familiarity with cutlist and BOM preparation processes, as well as an understanding of material selection and  optimization techniques. Stay updated with the latest hardware solutions and production techniques relevant to interior design projects.

column2: A controls engineer, also known as an automation engineer or a systems engineer, is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining control systems for various industrial processes and equipment     The primary focus of a controls engineer is to ensure efficient and reliable operation of automated systems in industries such as manufacturing, power generation, oil and gas, automotive, and many others       The job description of a controls engineer may vary depending on the specific industry and company, but here are some common responsibilities and tasks associated with the role:       System Design: Designing control systems that meet the requirements of the project, considering factors such as safety, efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness     This involves analyzing process requirements, selecting appropriate control hardware and software, and creating system architectures and specifications     Programming and Configuration: Developing control logic and programming software for programmable logic controllers (PLCs), distributed control systems (DCS), human-machine interfaces (HMIs), and other control devices     This includes configuring communication networks and protocols, implementing control algorithms, and troubleshooting software issues     System Integration: Integrating various components and subsystems of the control system, such as sensors, actuators, motors, and communication interfaces     This involves hardware installation, wiring, and ensuring proper communication and interaction between different elements of the system     Testing and Commissioning: Conducting tests and simulations to verify the functionality and performance of the control system     This includes performing system-wide tests, conducting factory acceptance tests (FAT) and site acceptance tests (SAT), and resolving any issues or bugs identified during the testing phase     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Diagnosing and resolving control system malfunctions, equipment failures, or performance issues     This includes troubleshooting electrical and software problems, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing corrective measures to restore system functionality     Regular maintenance and calibration of control systems are also part of the responsibilities
column11: Usage, Manufacturing technology, Consulting, Corporate, Packaging, Instrumentation, Operations

column2: Experience : 3 to 8 years. Location: Bangalore / Hubli. Job Title: Analog Circuit Designer Overview:  We are seeking a talented Analog Circuit Designer to join our dynamic team. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that the design meets performance specifications, reliability standards, and time-to-market goals. Responsibilities: 1. Analog Circuit Design: Design and develop analog and mixed-signal circuits such as amplifiers, filters, oscillators, voltage references, and data converters. 2. Simulation and Verification: Utilize simulation tools (e.g., SPICE, Cadence Virtuoso) to verify the performance of designed circuits under various operating conditions and corner cases. 3. Performance Optimization: Analyze design trade-offs and optimize circuit performance in terms of power consumption, area, speed, and noise. 4. Documentation: Create comprehensive design documentation, including design specifications, simulation results, and verification reports. 5. Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest advancements in analog circuit design methodologies, tools, and technologies. Qualifications: 1. Familiarity with layout considerations and understanding of layout parasitics. 6. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. 7. Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment. 8. Strong communication skills and ability to present complex technical concepts effectively. Preferred Qualifications: 1. Prior experience in designing analog circuits for high-speed or high-resolution applications. 2. Knowledge of semiconductor fabrication processes and device physics. 3. Experience with behavioral modeling and Verilog-A/AMS. 4. Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or MATLAB for automation and data analysis
